register.description: MODULE REVISION This register contains the IP revision code in binary coded digital. For example, we have: 0x01 = revision 0.1 and 0x21 = revision 2.1

bitfield.description: Revision ID

register.description: Information about the IP module's hardware configuration. It provides information about the generic parameters.

bitfield.description: Read returns 0.
Read 0x2: SIMCOP receives a main clock at 304 MHz plus a clock at 426 MHz for NSF and iMX

bitenum.description: SIMCOP receives a 400-Mhz clock. Some modules receive the 400-MHz clock and others receive 200MHz.

bitfield.description: Chooses the LDC working memory configuration

bitenum.description: Working memory only populated for YUV4:2:0 operation
Working memory fully populated. Supports YUV4:2:2 operation

bitfield.description: Defines the size of the LDC read master response FIFO in words of 128-bits.
This parameter defines the image buffer count.

bitenum.description: 4 Image buffers (e, f, g, and h)

bitfield.description: The NSF3 module is present when this parameter is set
The ROT A module is present when this parameter is set.
The IMX B module and the CMD b, COEFF b memories are present when this parameter is set.
The IMX A module and the CMD a, COEFF a memories are present when this parameter is set.
The NSF2 module is present when this parameter is set.
The VLCD module and the QUANT, HUFFMAN, BITSTREAM memories are present when this parameter is set.
The DCT module is present when this parameter is set.
The LDC module and the LDC LUT are present when this parameter is set.

register.description: This register controls the various parameters of the OCP interface

bitfield.description: Read returns 0.
Configuration of the local initiator state management mode. By definition, initiator may generate read/write transaction as long as it is out of STANDBY state.

bitenum.description: Force-standby mode: local initiator is unconditionally placed in standby state. Backup mode, for debug only.
No-standby mode: local initiator is unconditionally placed out of standby state. Backup mode, for debug only.
Smart-standby mode: local initiator standby status depends on local conditions, i.e. the module's functional requirement from the initiator.

bitfield.description: Read returns 0.
Software reset

register.description: Per-event raw interrupt status vector Raw status is set even if event is not enabled. Write 1 to set the (raw) status, mostly for debug.

bitfield.description: Read returns 0.
Event triggered by the HW sequencer to instruct the CPU to process a macroblock
Event triggered by the SIMCOP DMA. This event is automatically cleared at SIMCOP level when it is cleared at SIMCOP DMA level Check SIMCOP DMA IRQ registers.
The LDC2 bridge has generated an error.
An error has been received on the SIMCOP master port.
A decode error has been signaled by the VLCDJ module
Event triggered when the HW sequencer finishes the sequence: - the sequence step counter has reached the limit - all accelerator and DMA events for the last sequence step have been received.
Event triggered when STEP3 is activated by the HW sequencer
Event triggered when STEP2 is activated by the HW sequencer
Event triggered when STEP1 is activated by the HW sequencer
Event triggered when STEP0 is activated by the HW sequencer
This event is triggered by LDC when a macroblock has been processed
Event triggered by NSF3 imaging accelerator when processing of a block is done
Event triggered by the ROT A engine
Event triggered when IMX has executed a SLEEP instruction.
Event triggered when IMX has executed a SLEEP instruction.
Event triggered by the NSF2 imaging accelerator when processing of a block is done.
This event is triggered by VLCDJ when a macro-bloc has been processed (encode/decode)
Event triggered when a block has been processed by the DCT module and the filter outcome has been stored to an image buffer.
This event is triggered by LDC when a full frame has been processed
Event triggered by the SIMCOP DMA. This event is automatically cleared at SIMCOP level when it is cleared at SIMCOP DMA level Check SIMCOP DMA IRQ registers.

register.description: Per-event raw interrupt status vector Raw status is set even if event is not enabled. Write 1 to set the (raw) status, mostly for debug.

register.description: SIMCOP control register

bitfield.description: Selects working memory for NSF3. Memories attached to NSF3 as working memories cannot be used by any other accelerators. HWSEQ or HWSEQ SW override settings are ignored for those memories.

bitenum.description: No working memory attached to NSF3. NSF3 cannot be used.
IMX A + B coefficient memories used.
Image buffers a, b, c, and d used. Those image buffers cannot be used for other purposes. This setting has higher priority than the context configuration

bitfield.description: Controls if bursts issued by the LDC2 bridge could cross burst length boundaries. When this register is set, the LDC2 bridge only issues aligned bursts. Register can only be used when LDC_R_MAX_BURST_LENGHT is 32, 64 or 128 bytes.

bitenum.description: No. OCP transactions must be split

bitfield.description: Limits the maximum burst length that could be used by the LDC2 bridge
Read returns 0.
Limits the maximum number of outstanding requests to LDC_R_TAG_CNT+1
Read returns 0.
First OCP tag ID that can be used by LDC reads. It is SW's responsibility to prevent overlap with tags generated by the SIMCOP DMA Typically this value should be equal to SIMCP_DMA_CTRL.TAG_CNT+1
Read returns 0.
Switch for IMX # command memory
Switch for IMX A command memory
Switch for Huffman table
Switch for quantization table
Read returns 0.
Switch for LDC LUT

bitenum.description: The LDC module could access the LDC LUT.

bitfield.description: Selects input data buffer for LDC. Memories attached to LDC as working memories cannot be used by any other accelerators. HWSEQ or HWSEQ SW override settings are ignored for those memories.

bitenum.description: use image buffers a and b
use image buffers a, b, c, and d

bitfield.description: Selects working memory for NSF. Memories attached to NSF as working memories cannot be used by any other accelerators. HWSEQ or HWSEQ SW override settings are ignored for those memories.

bitenum.description: No working memory attached to NSF2. NSF2 cannot be used.
Image buffers a and b used. Those image buffers cannot be used for other purposes. This setting has higher priority than the context configuration
Image buffers a, b, c, d used. Those image buffers cannot be used for other purposes. This setting has higher priority than the context configuration

bitfield.description: Interrupt generation method

bitenum.description: The interrupt line is asserted when one of the events enabled in SIMCOP_IRQENABLE_3 is pending
The interrupt line is asserted when all events enabled in SIMCOP_IRQENABLE_3 are pending

bitfield.description: Interrupt generation method

bitenum.description: The interrupt line is asserted when one of the events enabled in SIMCOP_IRQENABLE_2 is pending
The interrupt line is asserted when all events enabled in SIMCOP_IRQENABLE_2 are pending

bitfield.description: Interrupt generation method

bitenum.description: The interrupt line is asserted when one of the events enabled in SIMCOP_IRQENABLE_1 is pending
The interrupt line is asserted when all events enabled in SIMCOP_IRQENABLE_1 are pending

bitfield.description: Interrupt generation method

bitenum.description: The interrupt line is asserted when one of the events enabled in SIMCOP_IRQENABLE_0 is pending
The interrupt line is asserted when all events enabled in SIMCOP_IRQENABLE_0 are pending

register.description: SIMCOP clock control register. Use to enable/disable the interface and functional clock of SIMCOP submodules. Disabled modules cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Read returns 0.

bitenum.description: Request shutdown of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already off
Request enable of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already on

bitfield.description: Read returns 0.
ROT A

bitenum.description: Request shutdown of the submodule. No effect if the submodule clock is already off.
Request enable of the submodule. No effect if the submodule clock is already on.

bitfield.description: IMX B
